----------------------------------------------------------------------------- Project : Core.Framework Class : Core.Framework.BaseFileObject
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Provides the base implementation for the IFileObject interface. This class handles the record structure accessed by the screen and implements the functionality of record retrieval, item initialization, and updating the database with the appropriate changes.
[Campbell] 4/11/2005 Created

--- Access -------------------------------------------------------------
Specifies default record-structure retrieval (WHERE clause) information.
A string containing the SQL condition. Use the Access event to set the default retrieval information for a record-structure. Developers can code leverage the benefits of the Access event when data retrieval for a given record structure is the same each time records are to be retrieved.
The example below specifies that the default retrieval information for the EMPLOYEE record structure
uses the EMPLOYEE_ID field to determine the records to retrieve with the value supplied from the Temporary
class T_TEMP_ID. This event is executed each time record retrieval takes place (ie. using the GetData or WhileRetrieving methods
without specifying a WHERE clause) so the value in T_TEMP_ID can change as this expression is evaluated each time.
For example, the following code will raise the Access event on EMPLOYEE (since no where clause is specified).
fleEMPLOYEE.GetData()
Private Sub fleEMPLOYEE_Access(ByRef AccessClause As String) Handles fleEMPLOYEE.Access
Try
Dim strText As StringBuilder = New StringBuilder("")
strText.Append(" WHERE EMPLOYEE.EMPLOYEE_ID = ").Append(StringToField(T_EMP_ID.Value))
AccessClause = strText.ToString()
Catch ex As CustomApplicationException
Throw ex
Catch ex As Exception
ExceptionManager.Publish(ex)
Throw ex
End Try
End Sub
[Campbell] 6/16/2005 Created
--- End of Comments ----------------------------------------------------

--- SelectIf -----------------------------------------------------------
Specifies filter (WHERE clause) information for data retrieval.
A string containing the SQL condition. Use the SelectIf event to set filter (WHERE clause) information that is applied each time data retrieval occurs. This filter is added regardless of whether a WHERE clause was specified for the retrieval or a Access event is used.
The example below specifies the additional filter criteria that is used for the EMPLOYEE record structure
This filter indicates that the STATUS_CODE of the EMPLOYEE record must be 'F' (Full Time) in order to be retrieved.
Private Sub fleEMPLOYEE_SelectIf(ByRef SelectIfClause As String) Handles fleEMPLOYEE.SelectIf
Try
Dim strSQL As StringBuilder = New StringBuilder("")
strSQL.Append(" WHERE EMPLOYEE.STATUS_CODE = 'F'")
SelectIfClause = strSQL.ToString()
Catch ex As CustomApplicationException
Throw ex
Catch ex As Exception
ExceptionManager.Publish(ex)
Throw ex
End Try
End Sub
[Campbell] 6/16/2005 Created
--- End of Comments ----------------------------------------------------

--- SetItemFinals ------------------------------------------------------
This event assigns a final value to the named items.
The SetItemFinals event is raised prior to updating data records in the database, and is initiated by the PutData method.
Private Sub fleEMPLOYEE_SetItemFinals() Handles fleEMPLOYEE.SetItemFinals
Try
fleEMPLOYEE.SetValue("HIRE_CODE") = "A"
Catch ex As CustomApplicationException
Throw ex
Catch ex As Exception
' Write the exception to the event log and throw an error.
ExceptionManager.Publish(ex)
Throw ex
End Try
End Sub
[Campbell] 6/16/2005 Created
--- End of Comments ----------------------------------------------------

--- SumInto ------------------------------------------------------------
Adds all values entered into the item specified.
Field name of the item that will be summed. Current value of item field. Old value of the item field. The SumInto event maintain the total of the item. This sum is automatically
incremented when values are entered
reduced when a data record containing the item is deleted
adjusted when the value is changed
In the example below, the HOURS_WORKED value is summed into the TOTAL_HOURS field of the WORK_PERIOD structure. By adding the (Value - OldValue) we are adjusting this value based on changes in the current field. (ie. If the value was 10 and the new value is 5, then we subtract 5 from TOTAL_HOURS).
Private Sub fleBILLING_SumInto(ByVal Field As String, ByVal Value As Decimal, ByVal OldValue As Decimal) Handles fleBILLING.SumInto
Try
Select Case Field
Case "HOURS_WORKED"
fleWORK_PERIOD.SetValue("TOTAL_HOURS") = fleWORK_PERIOD.GetDecimalValue("TOTAL_HOURS") + (Value - OldValue)
Display(fldWORK_PERIOD_TOTAL_HOURS)
End Select
Catch ex As CustomApplicationException
Throw ex
Catch ex As Exception
ExceptionManager.Publish(ex)
Throw ex
End Try
End Sub
[Campbell] 6/16/2005 Created
--- End of Comments ----------------------------------------------------

--- CountInto ------------------------------------------------------------
Maintains a count of the records entered.
The increment value. The CountInto event maintains a count of the records entered. This count is automatically
incremented when records entered
reduced when a records are deleted
The records are updated for File classes of type Delete when the PutData verb is executed.
In the example below, the EMPLOYEE record is counted into the EMP_COUNT field of the WORK_PERIOD structure.
Private Sub fleEMPLOYEE_SumInto(ByVal Field As String, ByVal Value As Decimal) Handles fleEMPLOYEE.SumInto
Try
fleWORK_PERIOD.SetValue("EMP_COUNT") = fleWORK_PERIOD.GetDecimalValue("EMP_COUNT") + Value
Display(fldWORK_PERIOD_EMP_COUNT)
Catch ex As CustomApplicationException
Throw ex
Catch ex As Exception
ExceptionManager.Publish(ex)
Throw ex
End Try
End Sub
[Campbell] 6/16/2005 Created
--- End of Comments ----------------------------------------------------

--- New ----------------------------------------------------------------
Initializes a new instance of the BaseFileObject class.
Required A type of file as defined in FileTypes Enumeration. Required An integer representing the number of occurrences of a record-structure to display. Required A string specifying the owner of the table. Required Base relation name (underlying table if aliased) Required Alias name of table. Optional No Items (no default initialization occurs) Optional No append is generated for this file (PRIMARY only) Optional No delete or detail delete is generated for this file Optional This option can be used to add blank data records or data records with initial and final values only. (Put verb treats record as changed) Optional A string representing a Transaction Name. Members contained in FileTypes:
Primary
Secondary
Detail
Reference
Master
Designer
Delete
Audit
Cursor

--- AliasName ----------------------------------------------------------
Gets or sets an alternative name for the record structure.
A string containing the alias name.
Assigns an alternative name to a record-structure. When a record-structure is declared more than once in a screen design, the AliasName property assigns a unique identifier name for each declaration. It is recommended to set the AliasName property in the constructor.
Once an AliasName is assigned, subsequent references to the record-structure must use this name.
Private WithEvents fleEMPLOYEE_ALIAS As New Core.Windows.OracleFileObject(Me, FileTypes.Primary, 0, "ABCD", "EMPLOYEE", "EMPLOYEE_ALIAS", False, False, True, 0, "m_trnTRANS_UPDATE")
[Campbell] 4/11/2005 Created [Mark] 21/7/2005 Added more details in remarks and added an example.
--- End of Comments ----------------------------------------------------

--- AlteredRecord -----------------------------------------------------
Gets or sets a value indicating if record has been altered or not.
Optional A zero based integer value indicating which row to get or set. Ommitting this value returns the current row's status. A boolean indicating if record has been altered. The current status of any file object can be determined using this condition.
If the record status has changed, then the property Alteredrecord should be set to true.
If fleEMPLOYEE.AlteredRecord Then
ErrorMessage("Cannot change employee record.")
End If
[Campbell] 4/11/2005 Created [Mark] 21/7/2005 Added an example.
--- End of Comments ----------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Gets or sets a value indicating that the current record is marked for deletion.
Optional A zero based integer value indicating which row to get or set. Ommitting this value returns the current row's status.
Protected Overrides Function Delete() As Boolean
Try
fleEMPLOYEE.DeletedRecord = True
Return True
Catch ex As CustomApplicationException
Throw ex
Catch ex As Exception
ExceptionManager.Publish(ex)
Throw ex
End Try
End Function

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
To handle GetData by passing GetData Options
A Boolean representing whether Data has been retrieved.
The options can be combined using the OR operator.
The option AddRecordToBuffer should only be used by the framework.
The CreateSubSelect option should only be used for a Detail file (in the DetailFind method) or for a Primary file (in the Find method). This parameter indicates that we are retrieving a subset of the records that meet the filter (WHERE clause) criteria, based on the Occurs property value and the current record(s) displayed. If the Occurs is set to 5, then only five records are retrieved at one time.
fleEMPLOYEE.GetData(GetDataOptions.Sequential Or GetDataOptions.CreateSubSelect)
[Campbell] 4/11/2005 Created
--- End of Comments ----------------------------------------------------

To handle GetData with only Where Clause
A string representing a SQL WHERE statement. A Boolean representing whether Data has been retrieved.
m_strWHERE = New StringBuilder(“ WHERE “)
m_strWHERE.Append(“ EMPLOYEE.EMPLOYEE_ID = “).Append(T_EMP_ID.Value)
fleEMPLOYEE.GetData(m_strWHERE.ToString())
[Campbell] 4/11/2005 Created
--- End of Comments ----------------------------------------------------

m_strWHERE.Append(“ EMPLOYEE.EMPLOYEE_ID = “).Append(T_EMP_ID.Value)
m_strORDERBY = New StringBuilder(“ ORDER BY EMPLOYEE.STATUS_CODE”)
fleEMPLOYEE.GetData(m_strWHERE.ToString(), m_strORDERBY.ToString())
[Campbell] 4/11/2005 Created
--- End of Comments ----------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
To handle GetData with Where Clause along with any Options
A string representing a SQL WHERE statement.
A Boolean representing whether Data has been retrieved. Please ensure you understand when to call this method.
You can use this method in following cases:
To pass prepared Where Clause along with internal CreateSubSelect
To pass prepared Where Clause along with any other GetDataOptions
You cannot use this method:
To pass complete SQL statement as Overrided, for that see other overloaded method
The options can be combined using the OR operator.
The option AddRecordToBuffer should only be used by the framework.
The CreateSubSelect option should only be used for a Detail file (in the DetailFind method) or for a Primary file (in the Find method). This parameter indicates that we are retrieving a subset of the records that meet the filter (WHERE clause) criteria, based on the Occurs property value and the current record(s) displayed. If the Occurs is set to 5, then only five records are retrieved at one time.
m_strWHERE = New StringBuilder(“ WHERE “)
m_strWHERE.Append(“ EMPLOYEE.EMPLOYEE_ID = “).Append(T_EMP_ID.Value)
fleEMPLOYEE.GetData(m_strWHERE.ToString(), GetDataOptions.IsOptional)
[Campbell] 4/11/2005 Created
--- End of Comments ----------------------------------------------------

A Boolean representing whether Data has been retrieved.
The options can be combined using the OR operator.
The option AddRecordToBuffer should only be used by the framework.
The CreateSubSelect option should only be used for a Detail file (in the DetailFind method) or for a Primary file (in the Find method). This parameter indicates that we are retrieving a subset of the records that meet the filter (WHERE clause) criteria, based on the Occurs property value and the current record(s) displayed. If the Occurs is set to 5, then only five records are retrieved at one time.
m_strWHERE = New StringBuilder(“ WHERE “)
m_strWHERE.Append(“ EMPLOYEE.EMPLOYEE_ID = “).Append(T_EMP_ID.Value)
m_strORDERBY = New StringBuilder(“ ORDER BY EMPLOYEE.STATUS_CODE”)
fleEMPLOYEE.GetData(m_strWHERE.ToString(), m_strORDERBY.ToString(), GetDataOptions.IsOptional)
[Campbell] 4/11/2005 Created
--- End of Comments ----------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
To handle GetData by passing fully prepared SQL that can be used to Get Data (with default options)
A string representing a full SQL statement. A Boolean representing whether Data has been retrieved.
Use this method if you ever need to pass complete Overrided SQL statement which does not rely on other parameters.
The first parameter "IsOverrided" is added to add overloaded method Passing it as False has NO impact, i.e. whether you pass True or False this function will treat it as True.
Use another construct If you need to pass Where Clause and Order By clause along with Auto Overrided SQL e.g. GetData(WhereClause, OrderByClause, GetDataBehaviour.CreateSubSelect)
This method allows the user to override the SQL using a specific SQL statement.
Dim strSQL As StringBuilder = New StringBuilder(“SELECT * FROM (SELECT DISTINCT EMPLOYEE_ID FROM EMPLOYEE WHERE EMPLOYEE_STATUS_CODE = ‘F’)”)
fleEMPLOYEE.GetData(True, strSQL.ToString())
[Campbell] 4/11/2005 Created
--- End of Comments ----------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
To handle GetData by passing fully prepared SQL that can be used to Get Data (with default options)
A string representing a full SQL statement.
A Boolean representing whether Data has been retrieved. Use this method if you ever need to pass complete Overrided SQL statement with GetDataBehaviour.
Don't use this construct to generate Overrided SQL Statement internally i.e. Use this method if you ever need to pass GetDataBehaviour other than GetDataBehaviour.CreateSubSelect.
To pass GetDataBehaviour.CreateSubSelect use Use another method, if you need to pass Where Clause and Order By clause along with Auto Overrided SQL e.g. GetData(WhereClause, OrderByClause, GetDataOptions.CreateSubSelect)
If you pass OverrideSQL along with GetDataBehaviour = GetDataOptions.CreateSubSelect this method will use passed OverrideSQL, completely ignoring the GetDataOptions.CreateSubSelect
The first parameter "IsOverrided" is added to add overloaded method Passing it as false has NO impact, i.e. whether you pass True or False this function will treat it as True.
This method allows the user to override the SQL using a specific SQL statement.
The options can be combined using the OR operator.
The option AddRecordToBuffer should only be used by the framework.
The CreateSubSelect option should only be used for a Detail file (in the DetailFind method) or for a Primary file (in the Find method). This parameter indicates that we are retrieving a subset of the records that meet the filter (WHERE clause) criteria, based on the Occurs property value and the current record(s) displayed. If the Occurs is set to 5, then only five records are retrieved at one time.
Dim strSQL As StringBuilder = New StringBuilder(“SELECT * FROM (SELECT DISTINCT EMPLOYEE_ID FROM EMPLOYEE WHERE EMPLOYEE_STATUS_CODE = ‘F’)”)
fleEMPLOYEE.GetData(True, strSQL.ToString(), GetDataOptions.IsOptional)
[Campbell] 4/11/2005 Created
--- End of Comments ----------------------------------------------------

Private Sub fleEMPLOYEE_SelectIf(ByRef SelectIfClause As String) Handles fleEMPLOYEE.SelectIf
Try
Dim strSQL As StringBuilder = New StringBuilder("")
strSQL.Append(" (EMPLOYEE.ROWID = ").Append(StringToField(fleEMPLOYEE.RecordLocation())).Append(")")
SelectIfClause = strSQL.ToString()
Catch ex As CustomApplicationException
Throw ex
Catch ex As Exception
ExceptionManager.Publish(ex)
Throw ex
End Try
End Sub
[Campbell] 4/11/2005 Created [Mark] 21/7/2005 Modified the example
--- End of Comments ----------------------------------------------------

--- WhileRetrieving ----------------------------------------------------
Retrieves and processes a set of records in a loop.
The WhileRetrieving method is used for specialized processing of a set of data records. It will loop through the records retrieved by the File class and execute the code within the loop for each record. Looping through the records will end when the last record retrieved in processed, or if the Break method is encountered. The WhileRetrieving method can only be used on Designer Files. Using WhileRetrieving on other file types may produce unexpected results
Do While fleEMPLOYEE.WhileRetrieving()
Select Case fleMPLOYEE.GetStringValue("GROUPSTATUS")
Case "BRO"
intGROUP_COUNT = intGROUP_COUNT + 1
Case "CAD"
fleEMPLOYEE.Break()
End Select
Loop
[Campbell] 6/16/2005 Created [Mark] 21/7/2005 Modified remarks and added example
--- End of Comments ----------------------------------------------------

--- Break --------------------------------------------------------------
Stops data record retrieval.
Used within a FOR loop to exit on a predetermined condition.
Do While fleEMPLOYEE.WhileRetrieving()
Select Case fleMPLOYEE.GetStringValue("GROUPSTATUS")
Case "BRO"
intGROUP_COUNT = intGROUP_COUNT + 1
Case "CAD"
fleEMPLOYEE.Break()
End Select
Loop
[Campbell] 6/16/2005 Created [Mark] 21/7/2005 Added an example
--- End of Comments ----------------------------------------------------

--- Break --------------------------------------------------------------
Stops data record retrieval.
Used within a FOR loop to exit on a predetermined condition. This function should not be called from outside the BaseFileObject.
Break with ForID should not be called inside the WhileRetrieving.
[Campbell] 6/16/2005 Created
--- End of Comments ----------------------------------------------------

--- Occurrence ---------------------------------------------------------
Gets the Occurrence value.
An integer value representing the current occurrence.
The Occurrence property indicates the number of times a loop has executed or the current record occurrence within a grid. For example, if working with the third record in a grid, the value of occurrence is 3. If a FOR loop is executing while working on the third record, the occurrence will be the number of times the loop has executed. When breaking out of the loop, the occurrence will have a value of 3 once again.

--- ChangeActivity -----------------------------------------------------
Gets or sets a value indicating that the current screen is updatable.

If ChangeActivity, DeleteActivity, FindActivity and EntryActivity are all False, then all these activities are considered True indicating that the user can find, delete, change and add new records on the current screen unless the code prohibits this explicitly (ie. by removing the code from within the Entry procedure).

--- URL ----------------------------------------------------------------
The URL that identifies where the help files are located.
This URL contains placeholders for the Language and Screen name. These are used to change the help being displayed based on the language being used by the current user (multilingual applications only) and the screen for which to display the help. This property is set in Global.asax.

Help.URL = "http://localhost/MYAPP/help/{LANGUAGE}/{SCREEN}.htm"
URL = Help.URL

URL = URL.Replace("{SCREEN}", Page.FormName)

--- PageModeTypes ------------------------------------------------------
Specifies the Mode types in which the designer is run for menu classes.
NoMode - No mode is specified
Find - Run through the Find phase

Select - This screen has no interface and runs as a process

--- RunScreenModes -----------------------------------------------------
Specifies the Mode for the subscreen.
NoneSelected - No mode was specified
Find - The subscreen is in Find mode when it first appears
Entry - The subscreen is in Entry mode when it first appears
Select - Not supported.
Correct - The subscreen is in Correct mode when it first appears
Change - The subscreen is in Change mode when it first appears
Null - The subscreen is not in any mode when it first appears
Same - The subscreen is in the same mode as the current screen when it first appears
Ghost - This screen is being called as a ghost screen

--- FileTypes ----------------------------------------------------------
Specifies the types of File classes.
Audit - Used to record data changes in a record structure and is usually associated with another File class.
Delete - Allows data records to be deleted from a file.
Designer - A record structure that is totally under the control of the developer.
Primary - The main file access by the screen
Master - A Primary, Secondary or Detail file passed from a higher-level screen.
Detail - A repeating record structure with a variable number of data records in relation to a Master or Primary file.
Secondary - A record structure in a file that is also to be updated in relation to record-structures in Primary or Detail Files.
Reference - A read-only file used for validation or retrieval.
[Campbell] 6/16/2005 Created
--- End of Comments ----------------------------------------------------

--- ExtractOption ------------------------------------------------------
Specifies the options for the DateExtract function.
Year - Returns a four-digit year.
Month - Returns a number between 1 and 12.
Day - Returns a number between 1 and 31.
Hour - Returns a number between 0 and 23.
Minute - Returns a number between 0 and 59.
Second - Returns a number between 0 and 59.
OptionDate - Returns the date portion of the item as a number in the form YYYYMMDD.
Time - Returns the time portion of the item as a number in the form HHMMSSTTT (where TTT represents thousandths of seconds).
[Campbell] 6/16/2005 Created
--- End of Comments ----------------------------------------------------

--- OnErrorOptions -----------------------------------------------------

--- PushTypes ----------------------------------------------------------
Specifies which command the push verb executes.
Append - Execute the Append procedure.
Delete - Execute the Delete procedure.
Entry - Execute the Entry procedure.
Find - Execute the Find procedure.
PreviousData - Executes the command to display the previous set of n data records in a grid.
PreviousRecord - Executes the command to scroll back one primary record.
NextData - Executes the command to display the next set of n data records in a grid.
NextRecord - Execute the command to scroll forward one primary record.
LastRecord - Execute the command to scroll to the last primary record.
FirstRecord - Execute the command to scroll to the first primary record.
[Return] - Execute the command to return to the previous window.
Update - Execute the Update function.

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
This method converts PowerHouse (PH) Match Pattern into the equivallent Regular Expression (RE) Match Pattern
A string containing the PowerHouse Pattern which is to be translated to a Regular Expression. A string containing the translated Regular Expression (RE) Match Pattern. There are certain characters which require special attention.
This function will not replace "!0" (NULL) meta character which is to be checked separately.
"ANY" Meta Character (?) of PH is translated to a "." Meta Character of RE which will allow any character except \n (New Line).
This function adds some of the RE Meta Characters as PH Meta Characters and then process that Meta Character as if they were PH Meta Character. However, this method returns it as a RE Meta Character.
This has been done considering the fact that:
All PH Meta Characters are also a RE Meta Characters however the Reverse is not true. i.e. All RE Meta Characters are not PH Meta Character.
